channel.title: Israel National Radio - Elan Adler
channel.description: Rabbi Elan Adler served as a pulpit Rabbi for 25 years in Stamford, Ct and Baltimore, Md prior to making aliyah on July 7, 2010. Rabbi Adler received his Smicha from Yeshiva University, had the privilege of being an aide to Rabbi Joseph B. Soloveitchik for two years, was an activist Rabbi in support of Israel and aliyah, and served as the President of the Baltimore Board of Rabbis. During his tenure as a Rabbi, he was known for being an engaging speaker and teacher, never failing to make easy connections with Jewish people as well as the non-Jewish and African American community. While serving congregations, he was appreciated for being welcoming, embracing of all people, and bringing congregants closer to their Jewish heritage. For more information on Rabbi Adler visit http://elanadler.com/

image.title: Israel National Radio - Elan Adler
image.description: A neo-Zionist perspective on Israel and the Jewish World.

item.title: A 40-second PSA about being a mensch has a huge impact
item.description:
The Derech Eretz Show

A 40-second PSA about Drerech Eretz and being a mensch has a huge impact.

item.title: BACK FROM THE USA: Derech Eretz musings
item.description:
The Derech Eretz Show

Long delays, layovers, hours and hours of sitting and waiting- does it test our character or polish it?
item.itunes:subtitle: Long delays, layovers, hours and hours of sitting and waiting- does it test our character or polish it?

item.title: Yom Hazikaron - Three Who Deserve Derech Eretz
item.description:
The Derech Eretz Show

Three groups who deserve Derech Eretz - Yom Hashoah, Yom Hazikaron and Yom Haatzmaut.

item.title: Derech Eretz: In the classroom and the newsroom
item.description:
The Derech Eretz Show

Rabbi David Samson shares about how to teach and reach Jewish kids at risk, and Jerusalem Post society columnist Greer Fay Cashman.
item.itunes:subtitle: Rabbi David Samson shares about how to teach and reach Jewish kids at risk, and Jerusalem Post society columnist Greer Fay Cashman.

item.title: Love, Freedom and Pesach Derech Eretz
item.description:
The Derech Eretz Show

When you insist people do what you tell them, and give them no choices, do you really love them? Is freedom part of love?
item.itunes:subtitle: When you insist people do what you tell them, and give them no choices, do you really love them? Is freedom part of love?

item.title: Husbands and Wives Help Each Other Clean for Passover
item.description:
The Derech Eretz Show

What can we learn about sensitivity and decency from a Torah portion filled with blood, guts ? You'd be surprised.
item.itunes:subtitle: What can we learn about sensitivity and decency from a Torah portion filled with blood, guts ? You'd be surprised.

item.title: Over the Line: Sports and Derech Eretz
item.description: The Derech Eretz Show Elan responds to reader email about the Beren Orthodox Day School's going to court to play on the court.
item.itunes:subtitle: Elan responds to reader email about the Beren Orthodox Day School's going to court to play on the court.

item.title: Beren Academy Basketball Stand Up for Shabbat

The Derech Eretz Show

item.title: Avraham Rosenblum: Dereh Eretz and Music
item.description:
The Derech Eretz Show

Jewish music icon Avraham Rosenblum shares his music and his thoughts on how soulful melodies can envelop us with true harmony.
